titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Park City Mountain Resort audio-visual collection 1961-2002
Park City Mountain Resort audio-visual collection
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Elizabeth Shuput and Tawnya Mosier.

publicationstmt.publisher: Multimedia Archives, J. Willard Marriott Library, University of Utah

repository.corpname: University of Utah Libraries, Special Collections

did.unittitle: Park City Mountain Resort audio-visual collection

physdesc.extent: Approximatley 210 VHS videocassettes, 33 U-matic videocassettes, 23 Betacam videocassettes, 3 Hi-8 videocassettes, 5 1-inch videotapes, 27 16mm films, 2 8mm films, 22 audiocassettes, 6 reel-to-reel audiotapes, 1 CD-ROM and 3 1/4-inch tape data cartridges.

did.abstract: The Park City Mountain Resort audio-visual collection (1961-2002) contains film, video and audio recordings, almost all of which are directly related to Park City Mountain Resort's role in Utah's winter sports industry and international competative ski ciruit. The colleciton includes promotional materials for the ski area, Utah's ski industry at large and the United States Ski Team, footage of the World Cup and other competitions held at the resort, ski films by Stein Ericksen and Warren Miller, and many other materials relating to the ski and snowboard industry in Utah and beyond. Founded in 1963, Park City Mountain Resort is one of three ski areas in the vicinity of Park City, Utah.

bioghist.head: Organizational History
bioghist.p: The town of Park City sprung up in Utah's Wasatch Mountains after army prospectors discovered silver in the area in 1868. Early miners used primitive skis and snowshoes as transporation to the mines, and skiing emerged a recreational activity by the 1920s. Scandinavian miners held jumping tournaments on the Creole Mine dump (now the Creole ski run to the Town Lift), and the newly formed Park City Ski Club conducted guided ski tours on the hills that make up the modern resort.

As the area's silver mining industry faded away in the mid 20th century, the town's last surviving mining company, United Park City Mines, received a federal loan to help revive conomically depressed rural towns and opened the city's first ski area, Treasure Mountain Resort, in 1963.

For its first four years of operation the resort featured the Skier's Subway lift, which carried skiers in modified mining trolleys two and a half miles through the pitch dark Spiro Tunnel to the Thaynes Hoist, where they boarded the old mine elevator and were lifted 1,750 feet to the surface near the Thaynes chair lift.

Treasure Mountain changed its name to Park City Ski Area in 1966 and to Park City Mountain Resort in 1996. Its sister ski resort, Park City West (later Wolf Mountain; now The Canyons) opened in 1968, and nearby Deer Valley opened in 1981.

Park City hosted its first World Cup ski race in 1986. During the 2002 Winter Olympic Games hosted by Salt Lake City, Park City Mountain Resort hosted the men's and women's giant slalom, men's and women's snowboarding parallel giant slalom, and both men's and women's snowboarding halfpipe events.

scopecontent.p: The Park City Mountain Resort audio-visual collection (1961-2002) contains film, video and audio recordings, almost all of which are directly related to Park City Mountain Resort's role in Utah's winter sports industry and international competative ski ciruit. The colleciton includes promotional materials for the ski area, Utah's ski industry at large and the United States Ski Team, footage of the World Cup and other competitions held at the resort, ski films by Stein Ericksen and Warren Miller, and many other materials relating to the ski and snowboard industry in Utah and beyond.

arrangement.p: The majory of the materials are arranged chronologically. Undated material is located at the end of the register beginning with item 224. Some items are available on more than one format.

accessrestrict.p: Materials must be used on-site; no use of original material, access copies will be made available for viewing. Five business days advanced notice required. Access to parts of this collection may be restricted under provisions of state or federal law, condition of the material, or by donor.

relatedmaterial.p: See also the Park City Mountain Resort photograph collection (P0949), the Park City Ski Area photograph collection (P0384), the Park City, Utah photograph collection (P0228) and the Park City Ski Corporation records (Accn 1218). For additional promotional audio-visual materials related to Utah ski resorts see the Ski Utah tourism audio-visual collection (A0590) and the Utah Travel Council tourism video collection (A0544).

processinfo.p: Processed by Elizabeth Shuput and Tawnya Mosier in 2003.

scopecontent.p: This film contains images of two men getting onto a helicopter and a scene of the outdoors from the helicopter. It shows a few shots of the state capital and then shows the grand opening of the Three Kings chair lift where one of the men from the first scene cuts a red ribbon at Treasure Mountain Resort, which will open in 1963.
This film contains raw footage of downtown Park City and of a family purchasing ski passes at the ticket booth, getting on the gondola and then skiing at Treasure Mountain Resort.
This film contains raw footage of ski lessons at Treasure Mountain Resort and of the ski class's lunch break at the lodge.
This film contains raw footage of a giant slalom ski race and of a hot dog ski competition held at Treasure Mountain Resort.

This film contains raw footage of ski lessons for beginner, intermediate and advanced skiers. It also shows footage of a woman sitting in front of a fire and then shopping while her young children wait at the daycare facility at Treasure Mountain Resort.

did.unittitle: Untitled Park City promotional skiing film

scopecontent.p: This film compares Park City in 1966 to Park City during it's silver mining era. It shows images of Civil War soldiers and Park City's mountains and the mineshafts. It then shows footage of a man being taken to a jail cell where he spends his time playing a banjo and singing. Other historical images include drawings of trains, the miners and the actual mining process, and of several men burning a certificate.

When the images switch to 1966 several people prepare to go skiing outside of the Treasure Mountain Inn. They get onto a gondola and get off at the summit house area. There are images of the skiers and then images of evening entertainment in the town.
At the end of the film the man in the jail is shackled to the cell wall. We see a man skiing, and finally the man form the jail steps out of the gondola and skis away.

This promotional film for Utah's ski industry was presented by Telescene Inc. It includes footage of the mountains at Park City, people traveling with their skis and then skiing, and footage from the hot dog ski competition at Alta.

This film about Olympian Stein Ericksen's career at Park City begins with footage of Ericksen organizing and teaching ski classes for beginning and advanced students. Footage of Ericksen setting up a picnic on the snow is followed by more ski lessons, Ericksen helicopter skiing, and Ericksen teaching slalom ski racing.

This film is a Warren Miller production and presented by Terracor. It features backcountry powder skiing, ballet skiing, the Sun Valley Farriman Cup Race, ski crashes and stunts, and a ski trip to Japan.

This film is a Warren Miller production. It begins with various shots of Park City and its surrounding ski areas. Several skiers go into the Park City mines on a small train (probably Treasure Mountain Resort's early Skier's Subway lift). The following scenes are of these men extreme skiing at Park City.
2 reels

This advertisement for Solomon ski equipment begins with images of ski racers and a woman's hand turning a ski boot attachment. Then you see the Solomon building where men are designing ski parts and machines are making the parts. The film ends with a short summary of the film interspersed with the Solomon logo.

This film showcases nine Rocky Mountain ski resorts including Aspen, Jackson Hole, Steamboat, Taos, Breckenridge, Park City, Sun Valley, Vail, and Winter Park. The featured skiers are Billy Kidd, Roger Staub, Jeff Jobe, Tom Leroi, Paul Pfosi, Arthur Furrer, Bill Peterson, Herman Gollner, Jean Claude Killy, Stein Eriksen, Ruedi Wyrsch, Pepi Stiegler, Corky Fowler, and Suzy Chaffee.
This film features Stein Eriksen leading a group of five people into the backcountry on cross-country skis.

did.unittitle: Hot dog contest skiing at Park City

scopecontent.p: This film contains footage from a hot dog skiing competition held at Park City. The contest includes skiers doing back flips and skiing moguls.

physdesc.physfacet: Color, black and white, silent, magnetic soundtrack

scopecontent.p: a) This is the original film of the Leo Kottke Concert in an outdoor amphitheater in Park City Utah filmed by the Park City Film Group (silent).
b) The same concert footage in black and white (work print, silent).
c) Magnetic soundtracks for films a and b.
This film contains footage of skiers skiing in a single file line, playing leapfrog on skis, and bunny hopping in place.

This film contains footage of an amateur play preformed on skis. The play begins with a classroom full of people. The villain of the play disrupts the class by running out. The next image is of a rubber ducky floating in swampy grass. The villain skis by the rubber ducky and stops to give some children a snack. Then you see the villain in the locker room stealing lunches. Next the villain kidnaps a young women and skis away with her. A young man sees the villain and starts to chase him; the villain knocks the girl out and skis away. The girl is rescued, but the villain later catches up to the rescuer and attacks him. This leads into a high-speed chase that ends with the villain being caught.
This film was produced for Big Sky of Montana and Hart Ski Company by The Film Factory.
Director: Jim Cotter
Writer: Duane Johnson
Music: Dale Mentea

The film begins with shots of skiers interspersed with shots of a red hot air balloon with "Ski the Sky" written on it. After some scenic shots from the sky, the balloon lands and there are more images of skiers. The scene shifts to the lodge restaurant and bar where tired skiers eat sandwiches, have a few drinks and dance. Next there are images of cross-country skiers, a horse-drawn sled, and people of all ages getting ready to go alpine skiing. The closing image is of the red hot air balloon leaving the ski area.

a-c) Olympic Medal winner Stein Eriksen takes you powder skiing through winter beauty, down a slalom course, over a summersault jump and through a few moguls. Then he leads you to the resort lobby where food and entertainment take over. Produced by Dick Barrymore Productions Inc.

d) This same film, this time introduced by a short black and white clip from the 1960's and 1970's which contains free skiing, downhill racing and footage of the torch run which is when several skiers organize a night skiing event in which each individual attaches road flares to the ends of their poles, hold them out at a ninety degree angle and ski down the hill.

a-c) This film is a Warren Miller production in which the spirit of an 'old timer' takes the viewer on a journey through time from the Old West to the modern ski resorts. It features skiing on the slopes and other resort activities.
d) The same film narrated in Japanese.
e) A very similar film used as a promotional video by United Airlines.
This film contains raw footage of ski jumping, dog sled racing, a torch run, and downhill skiing.
a-c) A detailed how-to film for the novice skier. Ski instructors conduct classes on skiin techniques at Utah ski resorts.
d-e) Revised versions of the film.

did.unittitle: Utah: The Greatest Snow on Earth short version

scopecontent.p: A promotional film for Utah's ski industry.

This video was produced by Dean Stephen Lyras. It is an exercise film that gets you in shape for skiing. There are seven 10-minute segments and each segment contains a workout designed specifically to strengthen one type of skiing: freestyle, helicopter skiing, ballet, telemark, and cross-country. Each segment is started out by a group of girls demonstrating each move. After this, there is footage of the type of skiing that corresponds to that particular workout.

Produced by Rocky Mountain Motion Pictures. This is footage of a womens giant slalom ski race. It shows the women at the starting gate, in the middle of the course, the scoring returns and the awards ceremony. There are interviews with the top two racers at the end of the film.

This video shows highlights from the fifth week of the 1985 Channel Five/Coca Cola Cup Race event at Park City Utah. This event is a giant slalom race on a course that drops 400 vertical feet and has 27 gates. The event is open to amateur skiers of all ages.

KSL's Jim Derkir narrates the video and reviews slope conditions and the history of Park City Ski Area. Before the races, Stein Eriksen gives a few racing tips. The results from the various age groups are reviewed, as are the results of all of the first place winners are reviewed.

did.unittitle: Park City Ski Area rough cut

scopecontent.p: Rough cut of an advertising film in which a family decides to travel to Park City, Utah to ski. It includes footage of Park City's facilities, restaurants, bars, and ski slopes. Featured terrain includes backcountry powder, moguls, groomed hills, and trees. The film also advertises Celebrity Ski Classics, which take place on the Park City race hills.
2 cassettes. The same footage repeated eight times.

did.unittitle: U.S. Ski Team Celebrity Ski Classic

scopecontent.p: The Celebrity Classic is a ski-racing event that is held yearly to raise funds for the United States (U.S.) Ski Team. The teams consist of athletes, celebrities, and sponsors. The races include head to head competition on parallel racecourses and individual "grudge" races. The individual "grudge" races consist of racing down the course with one ski, going down the course skiing backwards, having to tow a person in a toboggan behind you, or sliding down the course with two people on one piece of plastic. To wrap the event up, participants head indoors to hear Michel Martin Murphy perform followed by a few words from many loyal sponsors of the U.S. Ski Team.

This video contains two thirty-second advertisements. The first advertises a contest in which you could win a ski vacation to Park City, Utah. The second advertises Park City Ski Area's vast terrain and the resort's facilities.

Canadian Mountain Holidays (CMH) Heli-skiing presents "Heli-High," produced and directed by Dick Barrymore. This film is shot at Estar Base, which includes the Pucells, Selkirks, Monashees and Cariboos mountains. There is also footage from Val D'Isere, Zermatt, Chamonix, Aspen and Snowbird. The footage consists of skiers being dropped off at the top of a mountain by a helicopter and skiing down. It also shows how it is determined which mountains are the safest to heli-ski on by means of examining various snow layers.

This is a sixteen-minute coverage of the 1985 Special Olympics by Turner Broadcasting System (TBS) Sports. The footage includes the opening ceremonies, the giant slalom event, the downhill event, speed skating, figure skating, celebrity racing, and the closing ceremonies.
3 cassettes

unittitle.title: Park City Ski Area: Of All the Places in the World

scopecontent.p: Promotional video for Park City Ski Area.
3 cassettes

This is a promotional video for Park City's summer activities. Activities include golfing, tennis, hiking, horseback riding, hot air ballooning, water skiing, arts festivals, and live music indoors and out.
2 cassettes

This is a promotional video for Park City's winter activities. A few of the activities included are alpine skiing at one of the three surrounding resorts, cross country skiing at Jeremy Ranch, backcounty dog sled tours, snowshoeing, and hot air ballooning.
2 cassettes

This World Cup, held at Park City Ski Area, was the first World Cup in North America ever. This video contains footage of the Opening Ceremonies held at the University of Utah followed by the Salt Lake City Ski Ball at the Westin Hotel Utah. The featured races are the women's slalom and the women's giant slalom. After the races, a few words are said at the World Cup Closing Dinner.
3 cassettes

did.unittitle: America's Opening World Cup advertisements - "The Festival" and "The Flag Racing"

scopecontent.p: This video contains two promotional clips: one is for the U.S. Womens ski team and the other is for an event called the U.S. Ski Team Versus the World. Each promotional clip is 30 seconds long and gives dates, times, locations and ticket information.

This video has two promotional clips for Americas Opening World Cup ski races. The first one is a ten second version which gives the date, time and location. The second one is thirty seconds long and it gives a few facts, the date, time, location and ticket information.

did.unittitle: America's Opening World Cup - Birney revised

scopecontent.p: No description is provided because 1-inch videotape could not be played at our facility at the time this collection was processed. However, our capabilities are constantly changing. Please contact a multimedia archivist about the current possibility of viewing this material.

did.unittitle: Hyrum W. Smith seminar review tape

scopecontent.p: Hyrum W. Smith, one of the founders of the Franklin Institute Inc. and senior vice president of marketing, conducts a seminar on time management and organizational skills.

did.unittitle: Park City World Cup invitation raw footage

scopecontent.p: This video contains raw footage of Craig Badami, the vice president of Park City Ski Area, inviting everyone to welcome home the U.S. Women's Ski Team as they take on the world at the Park City World Cup ladies slalom event.

This is a promotional video for Park City Ski Area. It promotes both the town and the terrain with clips of city and ski slop activities. The advertised terrain includes groomed hills, backcountry powder, moguls, race hills and trees.
Radio advertisement for the Utah Symphony. 30 seconds.

did.unittitle: Park City Ski Area television news coverage

scopecontent.p: The first story covered on this video is about the Park City Midmountain Lodge, a historical building in Park City Utah, which was moved five hundred feet up the mountain and turned into a restaurant.
The second story is about the upcoming Pro Cup Ski Race at Park City Ski Resort. News reporters interview Mark Menlove, Holly Flanders and Scott Hofmann.

Jack Eddies Ski In honors the best skiing in North America and offers information on what is happening in the Western ski areas. In this episode Eddie visits Snowbird, Utah where he features the terrain, the Cliff Lodge, the racing competition, the friendly atmosphere and the beautiful scenery.

No description is provided because 1-inch videotape could not be played at our facility at the time this collection was processed. However, our capabilities are constantly changing. Please contact a multimedia archivist about the current possibility of viewing this material.

Promotional film produced by Travelview International. The video contains a 22-minute feature about Utah's ski areas, a reference guide providing information on Utah's ski resorts in Utah, lodging and accommodation tips, dining and tourist oriented services, and a Travel Tips segment.
This promotional video showcases Deer Valley's ski terrain, lodging, food, services, and summer season events.

The Senators Ski Cup is a race that is held annually at the Park City Resort. This event was organized by former Senator Jake Garn to benefit the Primary Childrens Hospital and raises around 100,000 dollars through friendly head to head slalom races.

More detailed footage of the Senators Ski race that is held annually to raise money for the Primary Childrens Hospital. The event was organized by former Senator Jake Garn and consists of a head to head competition slalom course.

Ski Scene is a television-program that tours various ski areas to show what they have to offer. In this episode, they travel to Sun Valley, Idaho. They review the history of Sun Valley, explore the modern site and pursue recreational adventures such as downhill skiing, cross country skiing, sleigh riding, and ice skating. They also rate the accommodations, restaurants and shops.

This news report documents a heated controversy of developing a ski interconnect in the Wasatch Mountains. The reporter introduces the four scenarios of development followed by a discussion between Gale Dick with Save Our Canyons and Craig Badami with the Utah Ski Association. They discuss many pros and cons for each scenario.

No description is provided because 1-inch videotape could not be played at our facility at the time this collection was processed. However, our capabilities are constantly changing. Please contact a multimedia archivist about the current possibility of viewing this material.
2 reels

did.unittitle: Park City Pro Cup television news coverage

scopecontent.p: These news reports discuss the planned events for the weekend of the Pro Cup Skiing race in Park City Utah. They showcase the Mahre brothers who are returning to competitive ski racing after a four-year hiatus after winning Olympic medals in Sarajevo. They show action shots of past Pro Cup winners and discuss dates, times, locations, and ticket information.
2 cassettes

did.unittitle: Park City Pro Cup awards footage

scopecontent.p: Footage of the awards ceremony for the 1988 Pro Cup held in Park City, Utah.

This is footage from the Pro Cup skiing event held at Park City, Utah. Featured are the men's and women's qualifying races, the men's slalom and giant slalom as well as the women's slalom and giant slalom.

This tape consists of a television news story concerning Park City ski resort. The story is about the Utah ski industry as a whole and hosts Beth Wood and Bob Gossler discuss Park City Ski Area in particular.
Other news stories included in the same episode feature Donald Trump and the disc jockey who inspired the film, Good Morning, Vietnam (Barry Levinson 1987).

did.unittitle: America's Opening: Park City Pro Cup

scopecontent.p: This is a 30 second advertisement for the America's Opening Pro Cup in Park City, Utah, Thanksgiving, 1988. There are various shots of ski competitions and sights around Park City set to instrumental music.

did.unittitle: TV 45 marketing promotional video, winter season

scopecontent.p: Poor quality VHS copy of local Park City television station TV 45's yearly marketing promotional video. The tape shows television and community highlights from the previous year in Park City, Utah. Marketing Director: Kim Steit.

A dress rehearsal of a dance troupe preparing for a performance at the 1988 Utah Ski Ball. The camera is in a fixed position throughout the duration of the tape's length while dancers perform on a recently constructed stage. There is also footage of electricians, etc.Â working on the last-minute preparations for the performance.

This tape contains images from the Utah Ski Ball in 1988. A man, who seems to be the evening's master of ceremonies, speaks about the silent auction. He then introduces the following people: Spence Eccles, Craig Badami, the CEO of the U.S. Ski Association (Howard Peterson), the director of the U.S. Ski Education fund (John Wilson), and a few other names including two female athletes who join the M.C. on stage. The camera remains on the M.C. throughout this presentation. Suzy Harris Rytting addresses the audience. Next, the dance troupe from cassette 37 performs for the audience at the Ski Ball. The M.C., who introduces Merrill Osmond of the Osmond Family, follows them. Mr. Osmond sings a number of songs and interacts with the audience.

This tape contains more images of Merrill Osmond singing. During his performance, Craig Badami gets onstage with him and together they sing, clap and try to get the audience to join in with the clapping. There are shots of the audience dancing and clapping in time.

The Senators Ski Cup is a race that is held annually at the Park City Resort. This event was organized by former Senator Jake Garn to benefit the Primary Children's Hospital and raises around 100,000 dollars through friendly head to head slalom races. After showing footage of various senators racing, the sponsors are interviewed. These sponsors include American Express, Park City Ski Area, Delta Airlines, U.S. West, BMI, First Security, Lucas Aerospace, and Textron.
2 cassettes

did.unittitle: News Travel Network: Park City Ski Area

scopecontent.p: This promotional tape for Park City Ski Area aired on the News Travel Network as a five part series. The episodes highlight Park City's mining history, the various recreational activities in and around Park City, the convenience of traveling to the ski area and lodging and dining in Park City.

1/25/89 "Salt Lake City hopes for 1998 Olympics". This news report covers the Olympic Committee selecting their favorite sites for the Olympics and the four venue plans that they are considering. In all of these plans, the cottonwood canyons are excluded due to environmental concerns.
1/27/89 "Ski Tax Bill". In this edition the pros and cons of the Ski Tax Bill are discussed.

1/28/89 "U.S. Journalists Visit The Wasatch Front". Nine U. S journalists visit Park City Ski Area, Snowbird, Sundance, and Snow Basin. After their visit, they give their brief thoughts on the Wasatch Front.
1/29/89 "Disabled Ski Championships". In this report various disabled skiers are interviewed and clips from the race are aired.
1/30/89 "Ski Resort Operators Convention at Park City Ski Area" This is a report on a convention that was designed to bring business to various manufacturers of mechanical parts for ski resorts.

This five part series on the struggles of the Utah ski industry was produced by KUTV news. Reporters claim that Utah resorts are falling behind the industry and cannot afford to catch up due to the Utah sales tax burden. As a consequence, several ski resorts are sold and some claim bankruptcy. In an interview with Snowbird's manager he discusses how the competition is beating Utah resorts and what Utah resorts plan to do to reach the top of the industry.
This is a 30 second advertisement for a ski competition. The competition is sponsored by 7-11, KJQFM, Koala springs, and MTV. The two dual slalom skiers who win the race will win a trip to Australia.
This tape contains four promotional songs for the skiing industry. Each of them encourages inexperienced skiers to get up to the slopes because you 'have to ski it to believe it'.
60 Second - Regional / Call Outs
60 Second - Ski Area / Call Outs
60 Second - Ski Shop / Call Outs
30 Second - Instruments With Singer Tag

This tape contains three sixty-second advertisements for Park City Ski Area's season passes and other discount tickets: "Ski Party" and "Ski the Best For Less." The advertisements follow the format of the game show Jeopardy.

This tape contains an advertisement for America's Opening World Cup event held at Park City, Utah over Thanksgiving weekend 1989. The advertisement highlights times, dates, event locations and ticket information and is narrated by a woman.

This tape contains an advertisement for America's Opening World Cup event held at Park City Utah over Thanksgiving weekend 1989. The advertisement highlights times, dates, event locations and ticket information and is narrated by a man.

This tape contains an advertisement for America's Opening World Cup event held the Park City Ski Resort over the Thanksgiving weekend in 1989. The advertisement highlights times, dates, event locations and ticket information and is narrated by both a man and a woman.
3 cassettes

This tape contains an advertisement for America's Opening World Cup event held at the Park City Ski Resort over the Thanksgiving weekend in 1989. The add highlights times, dates, event locations and ticket information and is not narrated.

did.unittitle: CNN Travel Guide - Park City Utah

scopecontent.p: This video contains the same footage as cassette 65 but was aired on CNN's travel program. The program highlights the history of Park City and how it evolved from an old silver mining town into a booming ski haven, how Park City is developing in order to become the ultimate Olympic venue, how to avoid long lift lines and where to ski and what types of recreation Park City has to offer in addition to the great downhill skiing.

This videocassette contains the opening ceremonies held at the University of Utah where senator Jake garner offers a warm welcome and congratulations to the athletes competing in the world cup. Following this, the U.S. Alpine Ski Team director speaks. Next they show clips from the actual races and the awards ceremony. Continued on 77.

Continued from 76. This tape contains footage from the Utah Ski Ball, dancing, and entertainment from musicians such as Ed Ames. This is followed by clips from the women's slalom and giant slalom races along with the official results from the two races.

physdesc.genreform: Betacam videocassette, U-matic videocassette, VHS videocassette

scopecontent.p: The Park City Street Dance accompanies the coming of the America's Opening event each year. It is a celebration of the love for skiing as well as an event to congratulate the athletes who compete in an America's Opening event. The street dance includes live outdoor music and dancing.
This video contains raw footage of the street dance and fireworks, the 1989 U.S. Pro Cup women's and men's giant slalom race, the crowds dancing and cheering and the flag parade.
This video contains raw footage of the women's giant slalom race, the men's giant slalom race, and the awards ceremonies.
This video contains an aerial view of Park City's mountains, ski runs, and mineshafts during the winter season.
This tape contains a 30 second news clip covering a helicopter crash in Park City, Utah.

did.unittitle: America's Opening World Cup: women's slalom

scopecontent.p: This video features the first and second runs of the women's World Cup slalom event. In addition to showing each competitor in the course, the film reviews the racers past accomplishments, current standings and future goals and reports on course conditions, weather conditions, and wins by course.

This video contains footage of the auctioning of trips and cars from which all proceeds go to the U.S. Ski Team. After the auction, there is live music from Ted Miller and the High Rollers and Bobby Freeman. The live music and entertainment is continued on cassette 85.
Continued from 84. More footage of live music and entertainment. The artists featured include Leon Use and the Coasters and Joe Muscalini.

This video contains reports on the importance of the World Cup. The reporters emphasize the fact that the World Cup acts as a tourist attraction, which in turn raises ski revenues. They emphasize the importance of improving Park City Ski Area's snow making technology so that they can always supply a reliable course for the World Cup events regardless of the weather.

This is an overview of the four-day Thanksgiving weekend World Cup event. The film casts the event as a celebration of accomplishments and a time to share an international love for skiing and features footage of the races, the crowds going wild, and the street dance held in Park City, Utah with live music and dancing.
2 cassettes

This tape contains two sixty-second advertisements for the America's Opening World Cup event held at the Park City Ski Resort over the Thanksgiving weekend in 1989. The add highlights times, dates, the event schedule and special events such as live music and dancing as well as ticket information. Danny Jessop on the radio station Magic 107.5 aired these advertisements.

This audiotape contains the memorial services for Craig Badami who was the Vice President of Park City Ski Area. C.B., as he liked to be called, handled the promoting and marketing for Park City Ski Area in addition to bringing the America's Opening World Cup Event to Park City. The services where broadcasted live over the radio station KPCW. While waiting for services to begin, the radio announcer reads through the program, announces the pasture as well as the speakers and the musical interlude. The services then begin with an opening invocation and prayer. Then the pasture reads several letters from various members of the Men's and Women's U.S. Ski Team, all honoring Craig's hard work. Following this, five of C.B's close friends share their own memories of his hard work and fun personality. The musical interlude was offered by C.B's very own band, Johnny and the P.C Rockers. The band then presents Nicholas Badami, Craig's son, with his harmonica. Five more friends share their loving memories and the service is brought to a close with a benediction.

did.unittitle: TV 45 avalanche story, Warren Miller feature, Al's Hill feature

scopecontent.p: This video contains three news reports:

The first is a story on avalanches. It includes avalanche statistics, the definition of the three different types of avalanches along with footage of each type, and information on what to do if you are ever caught in an avalanche.
The second report is a story on the upcoming Warren Miller production, Extreme Winter.
The third is a news report on a ski event named Al's Challenge. This ski event is a relay race that takes place during spring skiing. This coverage ends abruptly.

This is a promotional video for the U.S. Ski Team. It contains comments from the coaches and racers concerning the development of the team as well as comments from the sponsors on why they have chosen to support the team. There is also a brief explanation of each U.S. Ski Team event, what is required of the athletes as far as training, and why it is so important that the World Championships has finally opened in America.
This is a three-minute promotional song for the Utah Winter Games. Written by Judd Maher and Sam Cardon.
2 cassettes

This video is a John Sandy production and portrays the life story of Jimmie Heuga. The Jimmie Heuga Center was created to give physically challenged people a second chance by focusing on what they can do rather than on what they cannot.

Promotional video about Salomon bindings. The film explains the mechanics behind the bindings and the materials used in developing safer and lighter bindings and shows the various bindings produced by Salomon for different levels and types of skiers.

In this news special they discuss Flanders' past skiing accomplishments, current endeavors and future goals. Flanders also discusses her transition from world wide competitive skier to public relations employee at Park City Ski Area.
This tape contains a thirty-second advertisement for Rossignol skis and boots.
Promotional video for the U.S. Ski Team and Subaru's sponsorship of them. It reviews the history of Subaru's sponsorship of the team and the history and future of U.S. Ski racing. 12:31.

This video contains thirty-seconds of an advertisement for the Pro Cup event held at Park City Ski Area. It shows the beautiful mountains of Park City and a Pro Cup racer skiing the gates. The video ends abruptly.
This is a thirty-second advertisement for the fifth annual Pro Cup Ski Tour held at Park City Ski Area. The add includes information on times, dates and ticket information.

did.unittitle: America's Opening World Cup: women's slalom

scopecontent.p: This video contains ESPN's coverage of the 1990 World Cup women's slalom event. It begins with highlights from the first run and the corresponding results. Then VISA sponsors a profile of Eva Twardokens that includes a short interview. Next Nordica sponsors a ski fact, in this case, the difference between slalom and giant slalom skis. The second run of the women's slalom event is broadcasted live followed by a report of the final standings.

did.unittitle: U.S. Pro Cup raw race footage from Extreme Novo

scopecontent.p: This video contains footage of the street dance and fireworks held in the streets of Park City Utah along with the flag parade, balloon release, and the men's 1990 U.S. Pro Cup awards ceremony.
The next footage is of the 1990 U.S. Pro Cup Women's giant slalom race followed by the awards ceremony.
This video contains a report on a marine named William Thompson who saved six other marines during the Vietnam War. He is honored at Park City Ski Area with a bronze star metal.

This story is followed by a memorial for Craig Badami (1952-1989). In the memorial Mark Menlove offers memories of his friend and co-worker, they honor his accomplishments, and show past clips of various interviews with Craig himself.

did.unittitle: U.S. Pro Cup raw race footage

scopecontent.p: This video contains raw footage of the 1990 U.S. Pro Cup race held at Park City Ski Area. The footage includes a view of the race course and the crowds, a ceremony in which Captain William Thompson is honored with a bronze star metal (see 103 for more details), the women's giant slalom race, and the awards ceremony.

did.unittitle: U.S. Pro Cup Ski Tour, America's Opening slalom event

scopecontent.p: This video features the U.S. Pro Cup race at Park City Ski Area. The announcers give a brief history of America's Opening Pro Cup then they review the course conditions, the fastest qualifiers, the American qualifiers, and explain how a Pro Cup race is put on.
The video features runs from the rounds of 32 and 16, the quarterfinals, semifinals and the finals. Race results are reported throughout.
2 cassettes

did.unittitle: U.S. Pro Cup Ski Tour, America's Opening giant slalom event

scopecontent.p: This video features the U.S. Pro Cup race at Park City Ski Area. The announcers list the locations that the Pro Cup races visit on tour, they give a brief ski history on the top two racers and give a course description.

The video features runs from the rounds of 32 and 16, the quarterfinals, semifinals and the finals. Throughout the race the announcers report the race results and host brief interviews with various racers.
Starts, bumps, finish, flag parade and balloons, awards, races and announcers.

This video is a Warren Miller production and is a screening copy only. It highlights the extreme side of skiing with cliff jumping, snowboarding, deep powder skiing, and mogul skiing. The world's best freestyle riders travel with Warren Miller to Grand Targee, Blackcomb British Columbia, Breckenridge Colorado, to Vermont for the freestyle legends competition, the Colorado Rockies, to an untracked and unnamed mountain in Antarctica, Mammoth, France and to Moscow to find the greatest thrills on skis and snowboards. The U.S. Men's Ski Team and the junior race team are also highlighted in this production.

The corporate ski challenge is based on the idea of leaving the stresses of a corporate lifestyle behind and heading to the mountains to get some fresh air and to have fun. Each major corporation races against another in a relay race where the competitors play tug-a-war on skis and ski the course with only one ski. The race takes place at the Alpine Meadows ski area and is followed by live music and dancing.

did.unittitle: "The World According To Spyder", "Dress To Thrill", "Push It to the Limit"

scopecontent.p: "The World According To Spyder" and "Dress To Thrill" are advertisements for Spyder ski gear featuring the United States Ski Team, Team Michelob Light/ Spyder, Team Memorex/ Spyder, Scott Kauf , Nelson Carmichael, Robert Aguirre, Roger Aguirre, Scott Kennett, Torjus Berge, Ove Nygren, Niklas Lindqvist, Joel Gaspoz, Christian Orlainsky, Scott Rawles, Hansi Standteiner, Kent Kreitler, Bart Tuttle, Joe Vranka, Ski Club Vail Kyds, Jeff Temple, David Jacobs, Kevin Kaneda, Tom Arnstein, Rianne Aguirre, and Katherine Knowlton.
"Push It to the Limit" promotes extreme sports. It features extreme snow skiing, barefoot water skiing, motorcycling, skate boarding, climbing and kayaking.

This tape contains an advertisement for three interconnected mountains on the east coast: Killington, Smugglers Notch, and Piko. The advertisement highlights the snow conditions, ticket prices and short lift lines.
This tape contains two thirty-second advertisements for Park City Ski Area.
The first advertises Park City as a leading ski area due to it's large lift capacity, vast terrain, and low ticket prices.
The second advertises the resident coupon book offered by Park City Ski Area as well as other cheap ticket options for residents.

This tape contains four separate advertisements. The first one is for the Killington ski area and advertises the improved technology of their snow making equipment, the great terrain, short lift lines, and low-ticket prices. The second one is for Smugglers Notch in Vermont and advertises the great terrain, the short lift lines, and low ticket and season pass prices. The third is for Ski Blue and advertises the great powder and tree runs as well as low season pass prices. The fourth advertisement is for the Piko ski area and is in the format of a radio show. It highlights the high-speed quad lifts, the high elevation of their peaks, their long runs, and their plentiful expert terrain.

This video contains footage from a ski event held at Steamboat Colorado. The event includes driving four-wheel-drive vehicles on a snow and ice course followed by tips for driving in icy conditions, and a southwestern ski race. The ski race is not a typical race but more of a relay race on snow. The relay race includes tasks such as skiing through a patch of heavy brush, then through gates and putting a saddle on a horse with skis still on.

This video contains an episode from the British television show Ski Tips featuring Park City Ski Area. The show starts out with a brief history of Salt Lake City, and an interview with Merrile Osmond. It then turns to Park City to highlight the America's Opening races and the street dance, live music, and the Wasatch Brewery. After giving a brief history of Park City, the hosts hit the slopes and give some tips on carving turns. They tour Park City Ski Area and explain how the hostess program operates. They show the costs of traveling to Utah including airfare, car and equipment rentals, and accommodations.

This video contains a news report on a skier who was charged with trespassing because he was giving ski lesson at Park City Ski Area but was not an employee of the ski area. He entered a plea of Not Guilty due to his claims of receiving nothing in return for giving people a few ski tips.
This tape contains a thirty-second advertisement for Park City Ski Area's discounted season pass rates.

did.unittitle: "Introduction to the Gift of Skiing" commercials

scopecontent.p: This video contains two commercials and a promotional video:
The first commercial is a thirty-second commercial titled "Ski it to believe it" which encourages people to try skiing. The second commercial is sixty-seconds also encouraging people to learn to ski.

The promotional video "Getting Started" encourages people to learn to ski through correcting the preconceived notions that it is too cold or too difficult or too expensive. It provides information on renting equipment, accommodations, ski club programs, ticket prices, clothing requirements, and slope ratings and introduces skiing as a family sport and as a sport for people of all ages. 22 minutes.

This video contains aerial footage of Park City Ski Area and Park City's mine shafts as well as footage of the high speed quad lifts, clips from the Pro Cup Ski races, the weekend events from America's Opening World Cup races, and the main street in Park City, Utah.

This tape contains an advertisement for Park City Ski Area. It advertises Park City's high-speed lifts, short lift lines, great terrain, dependable snow conditions, and low-ticket prices by comparing Park City Ski Area to a fictional ski area called Mount Beagle.

did.unittitle: Etc. Etc. - Utah and Park City special

scopecontent.p: Etc. was a television series on the Travel Channel. This episode highlights Park City Ski Area in Utah. The show starts out with a special on the Utah ski patrol teams. They explain how they keep the slopes safe from avalanche danger and give some backcountry safety ski tips.

The episode then travels to Albuquerque, New Mexico to spotlight mechanics who restore Chevrolets and to Massillon, Mexico for great fishing tips. Next they spotlight Washington State for their delicious apples, Bahamas for the intense tourism attraction, and then back to Park City for a brief history review. They also spotlight the relationship between Park City Ski Area and the U.S. Ski Team.

Etc. was a television series on the Travel Channel. This episode highlights the Deer Valley and Snowbird ski resorts. They show how Utah ski resorts help to protect the environment during the ski season as well as the off-season.
The episode also spotlights unknown Mexico vacation destinations, learning to fly, and Eco tourism on the Bahamas peninsula.

Etc. Etc. was a television series on the Travel Channel. This episode gives a brief history of Park City's silver mining boom and why it became a bust. It introduces snowboarding as a new and exciting sport and spotlights a mountain that was built in Keystone Colorado.

They also travel to Australia to introduce a man who captures the land down under unlike any other man can, to North Carolina for the history of the Grove Park Inn, and to the Bahamas to introduce the family islands.

No description is provided because 1/4-inch tape data cartridges could not be played at our facility at the time this collection was processed. However, our capabilities are constantly changing. Please contact a multimedia archivist about the current possibility of viewing this material.
3 cartridges

did.unittitle: America's Opening World Cup advertisement, event video, closing video

scopecontent.p: This video contains three segments:
The first is the same advertisement for the America's Opening World cup as cassette 138.

The second is an event video of the America's Opening World Cup. In this segment, the Giant Slalom and Slalom courses are defined by the amount of time spent in each course and by the number of gates. It also gives a brief history of various U.S. Ski Team members.
The third segment is a closing video of the America's Opening World Cup. It shows the top three athletes in the racecourse and then receiving their awards.
3 cassettes

scopecontent.p: This video summarizes the America's Opening World Cup event. It also highlights the awards ceremony by showing the top three athletes racing and then receiving their awards.
4 cassettes

This video features extreme skiing at Park City Ski Area. It starts out with a geographical description of Jupiter Peak and Jupiter Bowl. These areas are then described by various extreme skiers while the footage of them skiing their plays in the background. Some of the skiers jump cliffs, some ski freestyle, others ski moguls or powder.

did.unittitle: Park City's America's Opening World Cup special

scopecontent.p: This video contains a fifteen minute special on the America's Opening 1986 World Cup event held at Park City Ski Area which was the first World Cup event hosted in North America. It shows footage of the opening ceremonies held at the University of Utah, highlights from the women's giant slalom event, and the official results and awards ceremony. It also shows clips from the Salt Lake City Ski Ball and the World Cup closing ceremonies.
2 cassettes

did.unittitle: America's Opening World Cup: Subaru women's slalom world feed

scopecontent.p: This video starts out with a shot of the racecourse from across the valley then shows the women's first and second runs in the slalom event. Throughout these runs, the camera periodically shows the current standings. After the race, there is footage of the awards ceremony and a few replays.

"Ski The West" is a series from a television program called Weekend Travel Update. This video compiles several episodes. "Ski The West" shows people how and where to ski in the Western United States, where to stay and what to do with any free time. They feature Park City Ski Area and Deer Valley for their dry, airy powder and their vast terrain, Steamboat, Colorado for their Cowboy downhill race and great terrain, and Squaw Valley for their terrain and surrounding attractions.

did.unittitle: Greg and Sarah Snow's wedding at Park City Ski Area (edited)

scopecontent.p: This video starts out with a view of Parley's Canyon and the surrounding mountains. Then it shows Greg and Sarah skiing together followed by the marriage ceremony which took place on the ski slopes at Park City Ski Area. Next it shows the signing of the marriage license and the newly wed couple says a few words into the camera.

unittitle.title: Subaru Ski World with Bob Beattie

scopecontent.p: Subaru Ski World is an ESPN program hosted by Bob Beattie. It contains various skiers' opinions of Park City Ski Area, an interview with Kristen Ulmer, an extreme skier, and a clip of her skiing from "Skiing Extreme V". Bob also interviews members of the U.S. Disabled Ski Team who offer advice to other disabled people who have never skied before. Next they show a clip about Colorado avalanche rescue dogs. Then Bob interviews Jeremy Nobis, a member of the U.S. Ski Team who had just had knee surgery. After this they show clips of horrendous ski racing falls and finally go for a tour of Park City, Utah.

Throughout the race, ESPN's announcers interview various competitors.

This video contains a news report on the cancellation of the Senators Ski Cup. The Senators Ski Cup was canceled because it was believed to have been a way for lobbyists to win over the popular vote of the senate on various political issues. Along with the cancellation of the Senators Ski Cup, restrictions were placed on what the senators could and could not accept. The restrictions include the termination of free trips and lunches, and the senators are no longer able to accept gifts from anyone but family and close friends.

scopecontent.p: Teck Talk is a show that was designed to educate people on how to find the appropriate ski equipment for their style and level of skiing. Peter Keelty and Holly Flanders are the hosts of this show and they feature five of the top skis in the following categories: giant slalom, "easy carvers" or shape skis, slalom, "groomer cruisers", all mountain and extreme or three-dimensional skis.

did.unittitle: Subaru Ski World with Bob Beattie: Utah Ski Areas

scopecontent.p: Subaru Ski World is an ESPN program hosted by Bob Beattie. In this episode of Ski World, Bob Beattie explains why Utah has the lightest and driest snow. He showcases several ski areas in Utah including Alta and Snowbird for the best powder and Deer Valley for being the most luxurious. Bob also hosts interviews with Stein Erikson, Tommy Moe, and Kristi Terzian.

unittitle.title: See For Yourself: Winter in Park City, Utah

scopecontent.p: This video contains an advertisement for Park City, Utah. "See for yourself. Discover why Park City is host to many venues for the 2002 Olympic Winter Games. It's three resorts in one great town. It's Deer Valley Resort, Park City Ski Area, and Wolf Mountain. It's the great snow conditions and abundant terrain (4700 skiable acres at the three resorts Â all within a five mile radius). You can even try jumping at the Utah Winter Sports Park - from the beginning ski play area to flying off the K-18 or K-38 meter jumps. Or if you prefer, you can watch the seasoned Nordic skiers soar off the 65 or 90 meter Olympic jump. Besides skiing, there is plenty to keep you busy. This historic mining town has more shopping, dining and nightlife than you have time for. And what's really worth seeing is how easy it is to get here Â just 40 minutes from Salt Lake City International Airport."

Ski Utah is a television program that was aired every Saturday November 9-March 8. Each episode follows a basic pattern: the hosts spotlight various Utah Ski resorts and give skiing or snowboarding tips.

"Ski Slate" is a calendar of events for ski resorts.
"Steep Thrills" is an introduction to extreme runs at local Utah ski resorts.

This video contains a report on Ski Resorts that are no longer famous for just skiing. They report on Sundance which is famous for it's summer mountain biking, hiking, horseback riding, and arts programs as well as Park City Ski Area which, in the spirit of evolving into a summer destination as well as a winter destination, has changed it's name to Park City Mountain Resort. Park City Mountain Resort is famous for its summer alpine slide, miniature golf, hiking, shopping and much more.

They point out the convenience and accessibility of each venue, the cleanliness and safety in the city, the plentiful accommodations, restaurants, and cultural events, and Park City's proven competence to host a world-class event. They also outline the anticipated venue locations.

did.unittitle: Picabo Street, Park City Mountain Resort media tour

scopecontent.p: This video contains a television interview with two time Olympian Picabo Street. Street discusses her serious injuries accrued while skiing in the World Championships in Switzerland and how they have forced her to make a decision of whether to start training in the spring for the 2002 Winter Olympics with a metal plate in her leg or to take the metal plate out, rehabilitate for a year, and miss the 2002 Winter Olympics in her home town.

This video contains an interview with two time Olympian Picabo Street. Street discuses the process of her injury rehabilitation and recovery and how it has effected her psychologically, her racing plans for 2002, which event she will specialize in, and what effects the upheaval with the Salt Lake Olympic Committee is having on the athletes.

This video is a celebration of the 2002 Winter Olympics. It starts out with the International Olympic Committee announcing that the 2002 Winter Olympics will be hosted by Salt Lake City Utah. It then shows crowds of people celebrating in various locations. This is followed by an explanation of Salt Lake City's three basic objectives. Their first objective is commitment to the athletes, the second is commitment to the Olympic values, and the third is providing a unique Olympic experience.

unittitle.title: Two of the Few in Jupiter

scopecontent.p: This video is a First Chute production and contains footage of extreme skiing in Park City Ski Area's Jupiter Bowl.

did.unittitle: Resort Cam - sports cam hand-free Video

scopecontent.p: This is a promotional video for the Resort Cam's hands-free video and the easy video toaster, which is used for editing film.

did.unittitle: "Operation Snowblast" - television, radio, and print advertising

scopecontent.p: This video contains a television, a radio, and a print advertisement for a skiing and snowboarding sweepstakes.

did.unittitle: Travel Travel episode 102: Ski Vail Colorado

scopecontent.p: This is a promotional video for Vail Colorado. It features facts about the Vail resort, dining, lodging and how to occupy your time off of the slopes. It also highlights Vail's sister resort, Beaver Creek. 28:30.

This is a radio advertisement for the America's Opening World Cup event held at Park City Ski Area over Thanksgiving weekend. The add highlights dates, special events such as live music and dancing, the event schedule and ticket information.

did.unittitle: Park City giant slalom world satellite feed reel 1

scopecontent.p: This video contains footage of the America's Opening World Cup women's giant slalom event. It begins with a view of Park City from the racecourse then the course conditions and start list are superimposed onto this image. Next is the actual race footage followed by the results list.
This is a promotional video for S.K.I. Limited, a ski corporation.
This is a promotional video for Park City Ski Area based on it being a family ski area.

This video contains a news report on a man names Ed Poquette who was charged with trespassing by Park City Ski Area. The claim was that he was teaching ski lessons at the resort but was not a resort employee and therefore was trespassing. See item 118 for more information on this story.
This is a promotional video for a man named Jonathan Olch. It highlights his history and accomplishments as a racecar driver, a professional ski racer, and a fly fisher.
This tape contains one thirty-second advertisement for Park City as a ski vacation destination.
This tape contains an advertisement for a listen and win program on the radio station FM 100. The prize is a holidy weekend give away of all day tickets to Park City Ski Area.

did.unittitle: Multi Market Media Park City, Utah demo tape

scopecontent.p: This is a promotional tape for Park City, Utah and contains six advertisements:
1) Say yes to Park City
2) Set your sights on Park City
3) You're the reason
4) Star lit nights
5) Ski heaven
6) Ski dream
This film by Destination Productions contains the native history of Park City, the mining history of Park City, and the current day entertainment in Park City.

did.unittitle: Underwriting credits for KUED program fund - Park City Ski Area

scopecontent.p: This is a twenty-nine second commercial for Park City Ski Area aired on KUED in return for their program funding from Park City Ski Area.
This video contains an advertisement for boot heaters made by Winter Heat. 2:58.

did.unittitle: This Is The Place: Salt Lake summer version

scopecontent.p: This is a promotional video for the Salt Lake Convention and Visitors Bureau. It promotes Salt Lake City as a great place to have a business meeting and to have fun. It highlights Salt Lake restaurants and clubs, summer activities, shopping facilities, business facilities and hotels and other accommodations.
This is a television production that shows various locals skiing different runs at Park City Ski Area.

This video contains footage of the America's Opening men's giant slalom event. For the first several racers, the camera is stationary at one of the first gates and the racers are in slow motion. Then the camera is positioned at the staring gate. It also includes footage of the winners on the podium receiving their awards.

This video contains an international travel promotion for skiing in the United Sates. It features ski areas on the East Coast and the West Coast highlighting resort facts, accommodations, dinning and entertainment. The video is concluded with a list of SKI USA resorts.

did.unittitle: Eastern Professional River Outfitters Utah ski vacation program

scopecontent.p: This video promotes a program run by the Eastern Professional River Outfitters where the river guides take clients to Utah to ski or they design the trip for their clients.

did.unittitle: Heuga / Mazda Express at Park City b-roll

scopecontent.p: This video contains raw footage of the Jimmie Heuga Mazda Express ski race held at Park City Ski Area. The footage includes the racers registering, interviews with some of the racers on why they compete in the race, and an explanation of what the Jimmie Heuga Mazda Ski Express is and how it came about.
2 cassettes

This is a promotional video for the Utah Winter Games. It includes facts about the Winter Games, where the venues will be, and which events are included in the games. The Utah Winter Games is run by a non-profit organization and its purpose is to support athletes and to showcase Utah.

This video contains footage from the America's Opening slalom and giant slalom events, the street dance and fireworks show, and pictures of Park City's silver mining era. The entire video is set to music and there is no narration.

This is a promotional video for the Resort Center at the base of Park City Ski Area. It features the Resort Center's accommodations, shops, the convenience of its layout, and the ski area. It also highlights the summer activities at the Resort Center.

This video contains a tribute to Crag Badami, Park City Ski Area's former Vice President. The tribute reveals Craig's history through his friends and families memories of him. The tribute also includes footage from the America's Opening World Cup events 1986-1989.

did.unittitle: In Utah all that Glitters is not Gold: Kens Television, San Antonio, Texas

scopecontent.p: This video contains a news report on Utah and, more specifically, Utah's ski areas. The report covers Salt Lake City's history, Utah's plans for hosting the 1998 Winter Olympics, the history of Park City, the Park City Ski Resort's facilities, Deer Valley's facilities, the Homestead's facilities, and Park West's facilities.

did.unittitle: Peek 'n Peak incorporation to WICU Television

scopecontent.p: This video contains a news report on Holly Flanders. The report includes Flanders' skiing history and her tips for young Peek 'n Peak ski team members.

This video contains both raw and edited footage of a news report on the winter recreation compared to the summer recreation at the Peek 'n Peak resort. The footage includes a race crew setting up a course, an interview with Holly Flanders, and Holly Flanders skiing the course that was set up.

This video contains the raw footage of a women's ski clinic at Park City. The instructor skis down the hill then each woman skis down one at a time. The camera films each woman from three different vantage points; the first is from below, looking up the hill, the second is directly from the side as the woman passes the camera, and the third is from above, looking down the hill.

did.unittitle: ESPN: Toyota Ski World with Bob Beattie

scopecontent.p: This episode of Ski World features a special on Alberto Tomba, the Winter Olympic Sports Park, scenes from Mt. Cook, Summit Of Extremes, and interviews with Kristen Ulmer, Jeremy Nobis and Shannon Nobis.

did.unittitle: Ski Utah with Kenneth Cowan - WHCU 870 AM / WYXL 97 FM

scopecontent.p: Side A of this tape contains a radio talk show aired on WHCU 870 Am and WYXL 97 Fm. The topic of this show is ski vacations in Utah and Kenneth Cowan is the guest. Kenneth discusses traveling to Salt Lake City with Park City being his ultimate destination. He discusses Park City's atmosphere, it's history, accommodations in and around Park City, and the ski area's facilities.
Side B of this tape contains a news report on the possible instillation of a water plant at the mouth of Millcreek Canyon and the Wall Street Journal report.
This tape contains an advertisement for Park City's season passes and their resident coupon book.

did.unittitle: New York Stock Exchange ski competition

scopecontent.p: This video contains a news report on a ski race held at Val Di Ser in France and on the New York Stock Exchange team who competed in this race. The footage includes the giant slalom race, the celebration held after the race, and a torch light run. After this report, there is footage from the Park City America's Opening Pro Cup Race set to music, a Pro Cup celebration party, and of live music and dancing.

did.unittitle: Team Deer Valley mogul skiing promotion / Bud Mogul Tour

scopecontent.p: In this video, Barry Johnson promotes the Deer Valley Pro Mogul team. The video also contains a news report on Park City's freestyle team which includes interviews with the team members and footage of them competing. Also included is ESPN's coverage of the Bud Mogul Tour.
This tape contains Park City Mountain Resort's employee orientation, which focuses on customer service.
